events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and filed a claim promptly after the accident occurred on April 30th.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and vehicle details.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to manage the investigation and customer communications.
The customer received acknowledgement of the claim submission and was informed of the investigation process.
Request sent to the customer for police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and witness contact information.
Customer submitted all requested documents including official police report and multiple photos of the accident scene.
Claims team began investigating the circumstances of the auto collision using the provided evidence and reports.
Investigation concluded confirming the liability and assessing the extent of the vehicle damage effectively.
A settlement offer was prepared and presented to the customer covering all repair and replacement costs.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the timely communication.
Claim was formally approved by the underwriting team following customer acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s account promptly.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment by the customer.
All files and documentation related to the closed claim were archived according to company policy.
